intro: Centella virgata var. congesta, commonly known as the dense-centella or congested centella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, rounded leaves. The plant produces clusters of small white to pale yellow flowers, which are often borne in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
